item.title: probplotlib: A Python Library
item.description: Probplotlib is a lightweight package that facilitates direct operations on Probability Distributions using interactive graphs. It is compatible with both - internal and external datasets as it directly initializes the values into a distribution instance. The backbone uses Dunder methods for optimization therefore making it faster than NumPy alternatives on processing benchmarks by 13%. It is available for public use at the Python Package Index as a library installation. This article comprehends my inspiration behind the project, the induced functionality and set of demonstrated examples!
